So let's see Alaska Senator Lisa Murkowski is one of only two senators to vote across party lines she voted against Kevin uh Joe Manchin of West Virginia Democrat
Being the other he voted for Kavanaugh I was wondering if you've been covering not just her but you've also been covering the people who are trying to influence her vote tell us about that what do you think based on what you had been reporting influenced her thinking on this I
Think she was very much um moved by all the women that came to Washington women in Alaska uh jumped on last minute airplanes got on red eyes and got up the next morning off the airplane without any sleep and you know went to lobby her and went to talk to her in a lot of them were
Um sexual assault survivors Alaska has a sky high rate of sexual assault and
A lot of them told their stories and um the ACLU sponsored a big group of Alaskan so a lot of them were lawyers and I'm name you know made their case especially about judicial temperament
Um they actually brought the judicial code of conduct into their meetings with her and she said that on the floor so a lot of the um survivors and attorneys I talked to who met with Lisa Murkowski in the last couple of days felt like they heard their arguments and their stories in her statement at least to some degree
And you also do a where the reporter who asked her if she had she herself had had a meat to moment which is something that a lot of reporters picked up on do you think that was relevant [noise] um

And I think that this is a reflection of the tribal ... of our politics and and the and the substitute of rage for argumentation you you really get the sense that no one any longer
Is trying to persuade anyone would it change anyone's mind or the goals seems to be
The beat the other side or to make heads explode and I think that's about a culture that's been coming along time and it's really come to a head

I hate boats I get claustrophobic
